COVERAGE	O
B	O
–	O
PERSONAL	O
AND	O
ADVERTISING	O
INJURY	O
LIABILITY	O

1	O
.	O
Insuring	O
Agreement	O

a	O
.	O

We	O
will	O
pay	O
those	O
sums	O
that	O
the	O
insured	O
becomes	O
legally	O
obligated	O
to	O
pay	O
as	O
damages	O
because	O
of	O
"	O
personal	O
and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
to	O
which	O
this	O
insurance	O
applies	O
.	O

We	O
will	O
have	O
the	O
right	O
and	O
duty	O
to	O
defend	O
the	O
insured	O
against	O
any	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
seeking	O
those	O
damages	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
have	O
no	O
duty	O
to	O
defend	O
the	O
insured	O
against	O
any	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
seeking	O
damages	O
for	O
"	O
personal	O
and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
to	O
which	O
this	O
insurance	O
does	O
not	O
apply	O
.	O

We	O
may	O
,	O
at	O
our	O
discretion	O
,	O
investigate	O
any	O
offense	O
and	O
settle	O
any	O
claim	O
or	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
that	O
may	O
result	O
.	O

But	O
:	O

(	O
1	O
)	O
The	O
amount	O
we	O
will	O
pay	O
for	O
damages	O
is	O
limited	O
as	O
described	O
in	O
Section	O
III	O
–	O
Limits	O
Of	O
Insurance	O
;	O
and	O

(	O
2	O
)	O
Our	O
right	O
and	O
duty	O
to	O
defend	O
end	O
when	O
we	O
have	O
used	O
up	O
the	O
applicable	O
limit	O
of	O
insurance	O
in	O
the	O
payment	O
of	O
judgments	O
or	O
settlements	O
under	O
Coverages	O
A	O
or	O
B	O
or	O
medical	O
expenses	O
under	O
Coverage	O
C.	O

No	O
other	O
obligation	O
or	O
liability	O
to	O
pay	O
sums	O
or	O
perform	O
acts	O
or	O
services	O
is	O
covered	O
unless	O
explicitly	O
provided	O
for	O
under	O
Supplementary	O
Payments	O
–	O
Coverages	O
A	O
and	O
B.	O

b.	O

This	O
insurance	O
applies	O
to	O
"	O
personal	O
and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
caused	O
by	O
an	O
offense	O
arising	O
out	O
of	O
your	O
business	O
but	O
only	O
if	O
the	O
offense	O
was	O
committed	O
in	O
the	O
"	O
coverage	O
territory	O
"	O
during	O
the	O
policy	O
period	O
.	O

2	O
.	O
Exclusions	O

This	O
insurance	O
does	O
not	O
apply	O
to	O
:	O

a.	O
Knowing	O
Violation	O
Of	O
Rights	O
Of	O
Another	O

"	O
Personal	O
and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
caused	O
by	O
or	O
at	O
the	O
direction	O
of	O
the	O
insured	O
with	O
the	O
knowledge	O
that	O
the	O
act	O
would	O
violate	O
the	O
rights	O
of	O
another	O
and	O
would	O
inflict	O
"	O
personal	O
and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
.	O

b.	O
Material	O
Published	O

Of	O
Falsity	O

"	O
Personal	O
and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
arising	O
out	O
of	O
oral	O
or	O
written	O
publication	O
,	O
in	O
any	O
manner	O
,	O
of	O
material	O
,	O
if	O
done	O
by	O
or	O
at	O
the	O
direction	O
of	O
the	O
insured	O
with	O
knowledge	O
of	O
its	O
falsity	O
.	O

c.	O
Material	O
Published	O
Prior	O
To	O
Policy	O
Period	O

"	O
Personal	O
and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
arising	O
out	O
of	O
oral	O
or	O
written	O
publication	O
,	O
in	O
any	O

,	O
of	O

whose	O
first	O
publication	O
took	O
place	O
before	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
the	O
policy	O
period	O
.	O

d.	O

Acts	O

"	O

and	O
advertising	O
injury	O
"	O
arising	O
out	O
of	O
a	O
criminal	O
act	O
committed	O
by	O
or	O
at	O
the	O
direction	O
of	O
the	O

.	O

applies	O
.	O

in	O

of	O

of	O
insurance	O

2	O
.	O
If	O
we	O
defend	O
an	O
insured	O
against	O
a	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
and	O
an	O
indemnitee	O
of	O
the	O
insured	O
is	O
also	O
named	O
as	O
a	O
party	O
to	O
the	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
defend	O
that	O
indemnitee	O
if	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
following	O
conditions	O
are	O
met	O
:	O

a.	O

The	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
against	O
the	O
indemnitee	O
seeks	O
damages	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
insured	O
has	O
assumed	O
the	O
liability	O
of	O
the	O
indemnitee	O
in	O
a	O
contract	O
or	O
agreement	O
that	O
is	O
an	O
"	O
insured	O
contract	O
"	O
;	O

b.	O

This	O
insurance	O
applies	O
to	O
such	O
liability	O
assumed	O
by	O
the	O
insured	O
;	O

c.	O

The	O
obligation	O
to	O
defend	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
defense	O
of	O
,	O
that	O
indemnitee	O
,	O
has	O
also	O
been	O
assumed	O
by	O
the	O
insured	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
"	O
insured	O
contract	O
"	O
;	O

d.	O

The	O
allegations	O
in	O
the	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
and	O
the	O
information	O
we	O
know	O
about	O
the	O
"	O
occurrence	O
"	O
are	O
such	O
that	O
no	O
conflict	O
appears	O
to	O
exist	O
between	O
the	O
interests	O
of	O
the	O
insured	O
and	O
the	O
interests	O
of	O
the	O
indemnitee	O
;	O

e.	O

The	O
indemnitee	O
and	O
the	O
insured	O
ask	O
us	O
to	O
conduct	O
and	O
control	O
the	O

of	O
that	O
indemnitee	O
against	O
such	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
and	O

that	O

the	O
same	O
counsel	O
to	O

the	O

and	O
the	O
indemnitee	O
;	O
and	O

f.	O

The	O
indemnitee	O
:	O

(	O
1	O
)	O
Agrees	O
in	O
writing	O
to	O
:	O

(	O
a	O
)	O
Cooperate	O
with	O
us	O
in	O
the	O
investigation	O
,	O

or	O
defense	O
of	O
the	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
;	O

(	O
b	O
)	O
Immediately	O
send	O
us	O
copies	O
of	O
any	O

,	O

"	O

"	O
;	O

)	O

:	O

(	O

)	O

"	O

of	O

SECTION	O

1	O
.	O

as	O
:	O

a	O
.	O

An	O

and	O

,	O

a	O

A	O

or	O

an	O
insured	O
.	O

Your	O
members	O
,	O

,	O
and	O
their	O

are	O
also	O

,	O

to	O
the	O

of	O
your	O

.	O

c.	O

SECTION	O
III	O
–	O
LIMITS	O
OF	O
INSURANCE	O

1	O
.	O
The	O
Limits	O
of	O
Insurance	O
shown	O
in	O
the	O
Declarations	O
and	O
the	O
rules	O
below	O
fix	O
the	O
most	O
we	O
will	O
pay	O
regardless	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
:	O

a.	O

Insureds	O
;	O

b.	O

Claims	O
made	O
or	O
"	O
suits	O
"	O
brought	O
;	O
or	O

c.	O

Persons	O
or	O
organizations	O
making	O
claims	O
or	O
bringing	O
"	O
suits	O
"	O
.	O

2	O
.	O
The	O
General	O
Aggregate	O
Limit	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
we	O
will	O
pay	O
for	O
the	O
sum	O
of	O
:	O

a.	O
Medical	O
expenses	O
under	O
Coverage	O
C	O
;	O

b.	O

Damages	O

SECTION	O
IV	O
–	O
COMMERCIAL	O
GENERAL	O
LIABILITY	O
CONDITIONS	O

1	O
.	O
Bankruptcy	O

Bankruptcy	O
or	O
insolvency	O
of	O
the	O
insured	O
or	O
of	O
the	O
insured	O
's	O
estate	O
will	O
not	O
relieve	O
us	O
of	O
our	O
obligations	O
under	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part.	O

2	O
.	O
Duties	O
In	O
The	O
Event	O
Of	O
Occurrence	O
,	O
Offense	O
,	O
Claim	O
Or	O
Suit	O

a	O
.	O

You	O
must	O
see	O
to	O
it	O
that	O
we	O
are	O
notified	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
practicable	O
of	O
an	O
"	O
occurrence	O
"	O
or	O
an	O
offense	O
which	O
may	O
result	O
in	O
a	O
claim	O
.	O

To	O
the	O
extent	O
possible	O
,	O
notice	O
should	O
include	O
:	O

(	O
1	O
)	O
How	O
,	O
when	O
and	O
where	O
the	O
"	O
occurrence	O
"	O
or	O
offense	O
took	O
place	O
;	O

(	O
2	O
)	O
The	O
names	O
and	O
addresses	O
of	O
any	O
injured	O
persons	O
and	O
witnesses	O
;	O
and	O

(	O
3	O
)	O
The	O
nature	O
and	O
location	O
of	O
any	O
injury	O
or	O
damage	O
arising	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
"	O
occurrence	O
"	O
or	O
offense	O
.	O

b.	O

If	O
a	O
claim	O
is	O
made	O
or	O
"	O

"	O

against	O
any	O

,	O

must	O
:	O

(	O
1	O
)	O
Immediately	O

the	O
specifics	O
of	O
the	O
claim	O
or	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
and	O
the	O
date	O
received	O
;	O
and	O

(	O
2	O
)	O
Notify	O
us	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
practicable	O
.	O

You	O
must	O
see	O
to	O
it	O
that	O
we	O
receive	O
written	O
notice	O
of	O
the	O
claim	O
or	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
as	O

as	O
practicable	O
.	O

c.	O

You	O
and	O
any	O

involved	O
insured	O

:	O

(	O
1	O
)	O

"	O

"	O
;	O

(	O
2	O
)	O
Authorize	O
us	O
to	O
obtain	O
records	O
and	O
other	O
information	O
;	O

(	O
3	O
)	O
Cooperate	O
with	O
us	O
in	O
the	O
investigation	O
or	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
claim	O
or	O
defense	O
against	O
the	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
;	O
and	O

(	O
4	O
)	O
Assist	O
us	O
,	O
upon	O
our	O
request	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
enforcement	O
of	O
any	O
right	O
against	O

person	O
or	O

may	O

to	O

because	O
of	O
injury	O
or	O

to	O

may	O

.	O

d.	O

No	O
insured	O
will	O
,	O

,	O

,	O

3	O
.	O
Legal	O
Action	O
Against	O
Us	O

No	O
person	O
or	O
organization	O
has	O
a	O
right	O
under	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part	O
:	O

a	O
.	O

To	O
join	O
us	O
as	O
a	O
party	O
or	O
otherwise	O
bring	O
us	O
into	O
a	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
asking	O
for	O
damages	O
from	O
an	O
insured	O
;	O
or	O

b.	O

To	O
sue	O
us	O
on	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part	O
unless	O
all	O
of	O
its	O
terms	O
have	O
been	O
fully	O
complied	O
with	O
.	O

A	O
person	O
or	O
organization	O
may	O
sue	O
us	O
to	O

on	O
an	O
agreed	O
settlement	O
or	O
on	O
a	O
final	O
judgment	O
against	O
an	O
insured	O
;	O
but	O
we	O
will	O
not	O
be	O

for	O
damages	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
payable	O
under	O
the	O
terms	O
of	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part	O
or	O
that	O
are	O
in	O
excess	O
of	O
the	O
applicable	O
limit	O
of	O
insurance	O
.	O

a	O

and	O
release	O
of	O

signed	O
by	O

,	O
the	O
insured	O
and	O
the	O
claimant	O
or	O
the	O
claimant	O
's	O
legal	O
representative	O
.	O

12	O
of	O

4	O
.	O
Other	O
Insurance	O

If	O
other	O
valid	O
and	O
collectible	O
insurance	O
is	O
available	O
to	O
the	O
insured	O
for	O
a	O
loss	O
we	O
cover	O
under	O
Coverages	O
A	O
or	O
B	O
of	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part	O
,	O
our	O
obligations	O
are	O
limited	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O

a.	O
Primary	O
Insurance	O

This	O
insurance	O
is	O
primary	O
except	O
when	O
Paragraph	O
b.	O
below	O
applies	O
.	O

If	O
this	O
insurance	O
is	O
primary	O
,	O
our	O
obligations	O
are	O
not	O
affected	O
unless	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
other	O
insurance	O
is	O
also	O
primary	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
share	O
with	O
all	O
that	O
other	O
insurance	O
by	O
the	O
method	O
described	O
in	O
Paragraph	O
c.	O
below	O
.	O

b.	O
Excess	O
Insurance	O

(	O
1	O
)	O
This	O
insurance	O
is	O
excess	O
over	O
:	O

(	O
a	O
)	O
Any	O
of	O
the	O
other	O
insurance	O
,	O
whether	O
primary	O
,	O
excess	O
,	O
contingent	O
or	O
on	O
any	O
other	O
basis	O
:	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
That	O
is	O
Fire	O
,	O
Extended	O
Coverage	O
,	O
Builder	O
's	O
Risk	O
,	O
Installation	O
Risk	O
or	O
similar	O
coverage	O
for	O
"	O
your	O
work	O
"	O
;	O

(	O
ii	O
)	O
That	O
is	O
Fire	O
insurance	O
for	O
premises	O
rented	O
to	O
you	O
or	O
temporarily	O
occupied	O
by	O
you	O
with	O
permission	O
of	O
the	O
owner	O
;	O

(	O
iii	O
)	O
That	O
is	O
insurance	O
purchased	O
by	O
you	O
to	O
cover	O
your	O
liability	O
as	O
a	O
tenant	O
for	O
"	O
property	O
damage	O
"	O
to	O
premises	O
rented	O
to	O
you	O
or	O
temporarily	O
occupied	O
by	O
you	O
with	O
permission	O
of	O
the	O
owner	O
;	O
or	O

(	O
iv	O
)	O
If	O
the	O
loss	O
arises	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
maintenance	O
or	O
use	O
of	O
aircraft	O
,	O
"	O
autos	O
"	O
or	O
watercraft	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
not	O

to	O
Exclusion	O
g.	O
of	O
Section	O
I	O
–	O
Coverage	O
A	O
–	O
Bodily	O
Injury	O
And	O
Property	O
Damage	O
Liability	O
.	O

(	O
b	O
)	O
Any	O
other	O
primary	O
insurance	O
available	O
to	O
you	O
covering	O
liability	O
for	O
damages	O
arising	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
premises	O
or	O
operations	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
products	O
and	O

operations	O
,	O
for	O
which	O
you	O
have	O
been	O
added	O
as	O
an	O
additional	O
insured	O
.	O

(	O
2	O
)	O
When	O
this	O

is	O
excess	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
have	O
no	O
duty	O
under	O

A	O
or	O
B	O
to	O
defend	O
the	O
insured	O
against	O
any	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
if	O
any	O
other	O
insurer	O
has	O
a	O
duty	O
to	O
defend	O
the	O
insured	O
against	O
that	O
"	O
suit	O
"	O
.	O

If	O
no	O
other	O
insurer	O
defends	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
undertake	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
,	O
but	O
we	O
will	O
be	O
entitled	O
to	O
the	O
insured	O
's	O
rights	O
against	O
all	O
those	O
other	O
insurers	O
.	O

(	O
3	O
)	O
When	O
this	O
insurance	O
is	O
excess	O
over	O
other	O
insurance	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
pay	O
only	O
our	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
loss	O
,	O
if	O
any	O
,	O
that	O
exceeds	O
the	O
sum	O
of	O
:	O

(	O
a	O
)	O
The	O
total	O
amount	O
that	O
all	O
such	O
other	O
insurance	O
would	O
pay	O
for	O
the	O
loss	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
this	O
insurance	O
;	O
and	O

(	O
b	O
)	O
The	O
total	O
of	O
all	O
deductible	O
and	O
self	O
-	O
insured	O
amounts	O
under	O
all	O
that	O
other	O
insurance	O
.	O

(	O
4	O
)	O
We	O
will	O
share	O
the	O
remaining	O
loss	O
,	O
if	O
any	O
,	O
with	O
any	O
other	O
insurance	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
described	O
in	O
this	O
Excess	O
Insurance	O
provision	O
and	O
was	O
not	O
bought	O
specifically	O
to	O
apply	O
in	O
excess	O
of	O
the	O
Limits	O
of	O
Insurance	O
shown	O
in	O
the	O
Declarations	O
of	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part	O
.	O

c.	O
Method	O
Of	O
Sharing	O

If	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
other	O
insurance	O
permits	O
contribution	O
by	O
equal	O
shares	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
follow	O
this	O
method	O
also	O
.	O

Under	O
this	O
approach	O
each	O
insurer	O
contributes	O
equal	O
amounts	O
until	O
it	O
has	O
paid	O
its	O
applicable	O
limit	O
of	O
insurance	O
or	O
none	O
of	O
the	O
loss	O
remains	O
,	O
whichever	O
comes	O
first	O
.	O

If	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
other	O
insurance	O
does	O
not	O
permit	O
contribution	O
by	O
equal	O
shares	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
contribute	O
by	O
limits	O
.	O

Under	O
this	O
method	O
,	O
each	O
insurer	O
's	O
share	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
ratio	O
of	O
its	O
applicable	O
limit	O
of	O
insurance	O
to	O
the	O
total	O
applicable	O
limits	O
of	O
insurance	O
of	O
all	O
insurers	O
.	O

5	O
.	O
Premium	O
Audit	O

a	O
.	O

We	O
will	O
compute	O
all	O
premiums	O
for	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
our	O
rules	O
and	O
rates	O
.	O

b.	O

Premium	O
shown	O
in	O
this	O
Coverage	O
Part	O
as	O
advance	O
premium	O
is	O
a	O
deposit	O
premium	O
only	O
.	O

At	O
the	O
close	O
of	O
each	O
audit	O
period	O
we	O
will	O
compute	O
the	O
earned	O
premium	O
for	O
that	O
period	O
and	O
send	O
notice	O
to	O
the	O
first	O
Named	O
Insured	O
.	O

The	O
due	O
date	O
for	O
audit	O
and	O
retrospective	O
premiums	O
is	O
the	O
date	O
shown	O
as	O
the	O
due	O
date	O
on	O
the	O
bill	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
sum	O
of	O
the	O
advance	O
and	O
audit	O
premiums	O
paid	O
for	O
the	O
policy	O
period	O
is	O
greater	O
than	O
the	O
earned	O
premium	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
return	O
the	O
excess	O
to	O
the	O
first	O
Named	O
Insured	O
.	O

c.	O

The	O
first	O
Named	O
Insured	O
must	O
keep	O
records	O
of	O
the	O
information	O
we	O
need	O
for	O
premium	O
computation	O
,	O
and	O
send	O
us	O
copies	O
at	O
such	O
times	O
as	O
we	O
may	O
request	O
.	O

.	O

.	O

SECTION	O
V	O
–	O
DEFINITIONS	O

1	O
.	O
"	O
Advertisement	O
"	O
means	O
a	O
notice	O
that	O
is	O
broadcast	O
or	O
published	O
to	O
the	O
general	O
public	O
or	O
specific	O
market	O
segments	O
about	O
your	O
goods	O
,	O
products	O
or	O
services	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
attracting	O
customers	O
or	O
supporters	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
this	O
definition	O
:	O

a	O
.	O

Notices	O
that	O
are	O
published	O
include	O
material	O
placed	O
on	O
the	O
Internet	O
or	O
on	O
similar	O
electronic	O
means	O
of	O
communication	O
;	O
and	O

b.	O

Regarding	O
web	O
sites	O
,	O
only	O
that	O
part	O
of	O
a	O
web	O
site	O
that	O
is	O
about	O
your	O
goods	O
,	O
products	O
or	O
services	O
for	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
attracting	O
customers	O
or	O
supporters	O
is	O
considered	O
an	O
advertisement	O
.	O

2	O
.	O
"	O
Auto	O
"	O
means	O
:	O

a.	O

A	O
land	O
motor	O
vehicle	O
,	O
trailer	O
or	O
semitrailer	O
designed	O
for	O
travel	O
on	O
public	O
roads	O
,	O
including	O
any	O
attached	O
machinery	O
or	O
equipment	O
;	O
or	O

b	O
.	O

Any	O
other	O
land	O
vehicle	O
that	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
a	O
compulsory	O
or	O
financial	O
responsibility	O
law	O
or	O
other	O
motor	O
vehicle	O
insurance	O
law	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
licensed	O
or	O
principally	O
garaged	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
"	O
auto	O
"	O
does	O
not	O
include	O
"	O
mobile	O
equipment	O
"	O
.	O

3	O
.	O
"	O
Bodily	O
injury	O
"	O
means	O
bodily	O
injury	O
,	O
sickness	O
or	O
disease	O
sustained	O
by	O
a	O
person	O
,	O

of	O

at	O
any	O
time	O
.	O

"	O

:	O

(	O

(	O

,	O

to	O

.	O

UCA825BCW	O

B&G	B-ORG
Foods	I-ORG
,	I-ORG
Inc.	E-ORG
117	O

Proposal	O

POLICYHOLDER	O
NOTICE	O
FOR	O

RETROSPECTIVELY	O
RATED	O
POLICIES	O

Your	O
insurance	O
policies	O
are	O
being	O
priced	O
under	O
a	O
retrospective	O
rating	O
plan	O
which	O
includes	O
the	O
Large	O
Risk	O
Alternative	O
Rating	O
Option	O
(	O
LRARO	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Large	O
Risk	O
Alternative	O
Rating	O
Option	O
provides	O
that	O
a	O
risk	O
may	O
be	O
retrospectively	O
rated	O
as	O
mutually	O
agreed	O
upon	O
by	O
carrier	O
and	O
insured	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
an	O
available	O
option	O
for	O
risks	O
that	O
meet	O
the	O
annual	O
standard	O
premium	O
requirement	O
for	O
Workers	O
Compensation	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
any	O
combination	O
with	O
General	O
Liability	O
,	O
Hospital	O
Professional	O
Liability	O
,	O
Commercial	O
Automobile	O
,	O
Crime	O
,	O
Glass	O
or	O
Workers	O
Compensation	O
.	O

B&G	B-ORG
Foods	I-ORG
,	I-ORG
Inc.	E-ORG
118	O

POLICYHOLDER	O
DISCLOSURE	O
NOTICE	O
OF	O
TERRORISM	O
INSURANCE	O
COVERAGE	O

SCHEDULE	O
*	O

The	O
portion	O
of	O
your	O
annual	O
premium	O
that	O
is	O
attributable	O
to	O
coverage	O
for	O
acts	O
of	O
terrorism	O
is	O
$	O
30,592	O
,	O
and	O
does	O
not	O
include	O
any	O
charges	O
for	O
the	O
portion	O
of	O
losses	O
covered	O
by	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
government	O
under	O
the	O
Act	O
.	O

Coverage	O
for	O
acts	O
of	O
terrorism	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
your	O
policy	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
hereby	O
notified	O
that	O
under	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O

Act	O
,	O
as	O
amended	O
in	O
2015	O
,	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
has	O
changed	O
.	O

As	O
defined	O
in	O
Section	O
102	O
(	O
1	O
)	O
of	O
the	O
Act	O
:	O
The	O
term	O

“	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
”	O
means	O
any	O
act	O
or	O
acts	O
that	O
are	O
certified	O
by	O
the	O
Secretary	O
of	O
the	O
Treasury—in	O
consultation	O
with	O
the	O
Secretary	O
of	O
Homeland	O
Security	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
Attorney	O
General	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States—to	O
be	O
an	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
;	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
violent	O
act	O
or	O
an	O
act	O
that	O
is	O
dangerous	O
to	O
human	O
life	O
,	O
property	O
,	O
or	O
infrastructure	O
;	O
to	O
have	O
resulted	O
in	O
damage	O
within	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
,	O
or	O
outside	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
certain	O
air	O
carriers	O
or	O
vessels	O
or	O
the	O
premises	O
of	O
a	O
United	O
States	O
mission	O
;	O
and	O
to	O
have	O
been	O
committed	O
by	O
an	O
individual	O
or	O
individuals	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
effort	O
to	O
coerce	O
the	O
civilian	O
population	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
or	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
policy	O
or	O
affect	O
the	O
conduct	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
Government	O
by	O
coercion	O
.	O

Under	O
your	O
coverage	O
,	O
any	O
losses	O
resulting	O
from	O
certified	O
acts	O
of	O
terrorism	O
may	O
be	O
partially	O
reimbursed	O
by	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
Government	O
under	O
a	O
formula	O
established	O
by	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
,	O
as	O
amended	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
your	O
policy	O
may	O
contain	O
other	O
exclusions	O
which	O
might	O
affect	O
your	O
coverage	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
an	O
exclusion	O
for	O
nuclear	O
events	O
.	O

Under	O
the	O
formula	O
,	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
Government	O
generally	O
reimburses	O
85	O
%	O
through	O
2015	O
;	O
84	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2016	E-DATE
;	O
83	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2017	E-DATE
;	O
82	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2018	E-DATE
;	O
81	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2019	E-DATE
and	O
80	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2020	E-DATE
,	O
of	O
covered	O
terrorism	O
losses	O
exceeding	O
the	O
statutorily	O
established	O
deductible	O
paid	O
by	O
the	O
insurance	O

coverage	O
.	O

(	O
if	O

)	O
.	O

of	O

/	O

.	O

Paid	O

-	O

or	O
Zurich	S-ORG
funds	O

TPA	O
:	O

of	O
the	O
calendar	O

following	O

effective	O
date	O
of	O

policy	O
(	O
ies	O
)	O

calendar	O
Month	O
.	O

to	O

will	O

for	O
incurred	O
losses	O
on	O
the	O
conversion	O
date	O
and	O
annually	O
thereafter	O
.	O

Aggregate	O
:	O
The	O
Aggregate	O
Amount	O
and	O
the	O
applicable	O
lines	O
of	O
business	O
are	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
Program	O
Summary	O
.	O

The	O
Aggregate	O
Amount	O
will	O
be	O
adjusted	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
based	O
upon	O
a	O
rate	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
Non-Policy	O
Agreement	O
applied	O
to	O
audited	O
exposure	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
the	O
Company	O
issues	O
the	O
premium	O
audit	O
bill	O
.	O

In	O
no	O
event	O
will	O
the	O
Aggregate	O
Amount	O
be	O
less	O
than	O
the	O
amount	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
Program	O
Summary	O
.	O

The	O
Non	O
Policy	O
Agreement	O
will	O
identify	O
the	O
sums	O
that	O
contribute	O
towards	O
the	O
satisfaction	O
of	O
the	O
Insured	O
's	O
Aggregate	O
Amount	O
and	O
those	O
sums	O
that	O
the	O
Insured	O
is	O
obligated	O
to	O
pay	O
in	O
addition	O
to	O
the	O
Aggregate	O
Amount	O
.	O

B&G	B-ORG
Foods	I-ORG
,	I-ORG
Inc.	E-ORG
127	O

Proposal	O

The	O
Insured	O
may	O
not	O
transfer	O
its	O
rights	O
and	O
obligations	O
arising	O
under	O
the	O
policy	O

Insured	O
may	O
not	O

or	O
otherwise	O
transfer	O
any	O
of	O
its	O
rights	O
and	O

.	O

B&G	B-ORG
Foods	I-ORG
,	I-ORG
Inc.	E-ORG
128	O

Proposal	O

Customer	O
Services	O

At	O
Zurich	S-ORG
,	O
our	O
commitment	O
to	O
superior	O
service	O
goes	O
far	O
beyond	O
concluding	O
claims	O
fairly	O
and	O
quickly	O
.	O

We	O
recognize	O
that	O
80	O
%	O
of	O
your	O
premium	O
dollars	O
go	O
directly	O
to	O
“	O
loss	O
costs	O
”	O
–	O
the	O
actual	O
cost	O
of	O
your	O
loss	O
,	O
once	O
it	O
occurs	O
.	O

That	O
is	O
why	O
we	O
are	O
committed	O
to	O
managing	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
your	O
claims	O
.	O

We	O
took	O
an	O
aggressive	O
approach	O
to	O
this	O
matter	O
and	O
developed	O
many	O
cost	O
containment	O
programs	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
tailored	O
to	O
your	O
specific	O
needs	O
.	O

Our	O
programs	O
are	O
designed	O
to	O
improve	O
control	O
over	O
your	O
losses	O
so	O
we	O
can	O
help	O
you	O
close	O
claims	O
for	O
less	O
money	O
.	O

To	O
begin	O
the	O
process	O
,	O
is	O
to	O
report	O
a	O
claim	O
,	O
and	O
Zurich	S-ORG
's	O
toll	O
-	O
free	O
Claim	O
Reporting	O
Center	O
is	O
available	O
24	O
hours	O
a	O
day	O
/	O
7	O
days	O
a	O
week	O
.	O

Claims	O
can	O
be	O
reported	O
via	O
phone	O
,	O
fax	O
,	O
email	O
or	O
via	O
the	O
Internet	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
fee	O
associated	O
with	O
this	O
benefit	O
.	O

Zurich	S-ORG
offers	O
a	O
dedicated	O
Account	O

who	O
will	O
guide	O

transition	O

who	O

in	O

of	O
Service	O
installation	O
.	O

account	O

Protocols	O
.	O

may	O

as	O
your	O

.	O

mining	O
,	O
fully	O
dedicated	O
personnel	O
,	O
recovery	O
panel	O
counsel	O
,	O
forensic	O
engineering	O
and	O
other	O
leveraged	O
programs	O
assist	O
in	O
driving	O
results	O
.	O

Zurich	B-ORG
Recovery	I-ORG
Services	E-ORG
will	O
charge	O
seventeen	O
percent	O
(	O
17	O
%	O
)	O
*	O
of	O
the	O
gross	O
amount	O
recovered	O
from	O
the	O
third	O
parties	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
loss	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
recovery	O
is	O
not	O
produced	O
,	O
a	O
fee	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
earned	O
.	O

Associated	O
expense	O
in	O
pursuit	O
of	O
recovery	O
will	O
be	O
charged	O
to	O
the	O
claim	O
file	O
.	O

B&G	B-ORG
Foods	I-ORG
,	I-ORG
Inc.	E-ORG
134	O

Proposal	O

Continuation	O
of	O
Services	O

Certain	O
services	O
will	O
change	O
to	O
a	O
standard	O
arrangement	O
if	O
your	O
insurance	O
program	O
should	O
move	O
to	O
another	O
carrier	O
(	O
non-renewal	O
/	O
termination	O
)	O
.	O

Upon	O
the	O
non-renewal	O
/	O
termination	O
of	O
your	O
program	O
with	O
Zurich	S-ORG
,	O
the	O

of	O
these	O
“	O
ongoing	O
”	O
services	O
as	O
well	O

for	O
your	O

be	O

to	O
our	O

Unit	O
(	O
“	O

”	O
)	O
,	O
a	O

unit	O

our	O
Schaumburg	B-LOC_PART
,	I-LOC_PART

office	O

in	O

and	O

“	O
inactive	O
”	O
customers	O

is	O
equipped	O
to	O
handle	O
all	O
of	O
your	O
underwriting	O
and	O
servicing	O
needs	O

/	O
or	O
issues	O
.	O

levels	O

.	O

.	O

3	O
3	O

DESCRIPTION	O
OF	O
OPERATIONS	O

RAF	B-ORG
Industries	I-ORG
,	I-ORG
Inc.	E-ORG
www.rafind.com	S-WEBSITE

Founded	O
in	O
1979	O
by	O
Robert	B-CONTACT
A.	I-CONTACT
Fox	E-CONTACT
and	O
headquartered	O
in	O
Pennsylvania	O
.	O

RAF	S-ORG

Industries	S-ORG
acquires	O
and	O
operates	O
a	O
diversified	O
group	O
of	O
middle	O
market	O
manufacturing	O
companies	O
located	O
across	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
.	O

Currently	O
,	O
18	O
companies	O
(	O
affiliates	O
)	O
are	O
engaged	O
in	O
the	O
manufacturing	O
of	O
various	O
products	O
including	O
on	O
Giftware	O
and	O
Promotional	O
Products	O
,	O
Industrial	O
Products	O
and	O
Building	O
and	O
D-	O
I	O
-	O
Y	O
Products	O
.	O

Development	O
is	O
RAF	S-ORG
’s	O
business	O
–	O
not	O
buying	O
and	O
selling	O
,	O
but	O
building	O
.	O

We	O
seek	O
to	O
keep	O
former	O
owners	O
actively	O
involved	O
,	O
offering	O
incentives	O
to	O
foster	O
their	O
entrepreneurial	O
spirit	O
.	O

With	O
our	O
resources	O
and	O
strategic	O
planning	O
,	O
we	O
enhance	O
company	O
operations	O
in	O
a	O
truly	O
cooperative	O
manner	O
,	O
allowing	O
each	O
business	O
to	O
achieve	O
excellence	O
.	O

Because	O
RAF	S-ORG
invests	O
its	O
own	O
money	O
using	O
long	O
-	O
range	O
vision	O
,	O
we	O
can	O
focus	O
on	O
the	O
culture	O
of	O
our	O
businesses	O
.	O

We	O
identify	O
a	O
company	O
’s	O
driving	O

General	O
Information	O

?	O

The	O
company	O
does	O
not	O
manufacture	O
or	O
install	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
products	O
they	O
distribute	O
?	O

The	O
vast	O
majority	O
of	O
products	O
are	O
purchased	O
from	O
US	O
based	O
manufactures	O

Over	O
90	O
%	O
of	O
Interior	O
and	O
Wallboard	O
products	O
are	O
purchased	O
from	O
the	O
following	O
major	O
US	O
manufacturers	O
.	O

-	O
Georgia	B-ORG
Pacific	I-ORG
Building	I-ORG
Products	E-ORG
-	O
National	B-ORG
Gypsum	E-ORG
-	O
US	B-ORG
Gypsum	E-ORG
-	O

Eagle	B-ORG
Materials	E-ORG
-	O
CertainTeed	S-ORG
-	O
Continental	B-ORG
Building	I-ORG
Products	E-ORG

Over	O
80	O
%	O
of	O
Roofing	O
Supplies	O
are	O
purchased	O
from	O
the	O
following	O
major	O
US	O
manufactures	O
.	O

-	O
TAMKO	B-ORG
Building	I-ORG
Products	E-ORG
-	O
Carlisle	S-ORG
-	O
Firestone	S-ORG
-	O
Johns	B-ORG
Manville	E-ORG
-	O
Owens	B-ORG
Corning	E-ORG
-	O
CertainTeed	S-ORG
-	O
GAF	S-ORG

?	O

They	O
do	O
sell	O
private	O
labeled	O
products	O
but	O
they	O
are	O
clearly	O
marked	O
to	O
identify	O
that	O
they	O
are	O
not	O
the	O
manufacturer	O
.	O
?	O

Beacon	S-ORG
has	O
reviewed	O
Allied	S-ORG
’s	O
safety	O
practice	O
and	O
has	O
developed	O
a	O
comprehensive	O
integration	O
plan	O
to	O
take	O
the	O
best	O

practices	O
from	O
each	O
company	O
.	O

?	O

It	O
is	O
Beacon	S-ORG
’s	O
practice	O
for	O
delivery	O
personnel	O
to	O
perform	O
a	O
visual	O
inspection	O
of	O
the	O
roof	O
before	O
roof	O
top	O
deliver	O
is	O

made	O
.	O
If	O
there	O
is	O
concern	O
about	O
weight	O
bearing	O
capacity	O
,	O
they	O
either	O
drop	O
the	O
materials	O
on	O
the	O
ground	O
or	O
use	O
a	O
conveyor	O
.	O

?	O

It	O
is	O
Beacons	S-ORG
preference	O
to	O
load	O
customer	O
’s	O
trucks	O
at	O
their	O
branch	O
locations	O
.	O
The	O
customer	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
securing	O
the	O
load	O
.	O

?	O

Beacon	S-ORG
has	O
about	O
50	O
union	O
employees	O
.	O
Allied	S-ORG
has	O
about	O
500	O
.	O

?	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
tiered	O
approach	O
to	O
allocating	O
workers	O
’	O
compensation	O
cost	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
branches	O
.	O

The	O
smaller	O
branches	O

(	O
as	O
defined	O
by	O
revenue	O
)	O
are	O
charged	O
a	O
maximum	O
of	O
$	O
50,000	O
per	O
claim	O
.	O

The	O
larger	O
ones	O
are	O
charged	O
a	O
maximum	O
of	O
$	O
150,000	O
.	O

?	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
penalty	O
for	O
late	O
reporting	O
of	O
WC	O
claims	O
.	O

The	O
branch	O
is	O
fined	O
$	O
1,000	O
a	O
day	O
for	O
late	O
reporting	O
.	O

Late	O
reporting	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
more	O
than	O
1	O
day	O
from	O
the	O
time	O
the	O
employee	O
reports	O
it	O
to	O
the	O
manager	O
and	O
the	O
carrier	O
is	O
notified	O
.	O

?	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
$	O
3,000	O
per	O
violation	O
up	O
to	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
$	O
9.000	O
per	O
inspection	O
that	O
is	O
charged	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
branch	O
for	O
a	O
preventable	O
DOT	O
violation	O
.	O

All	O
violations	O
are	O
tracked	O
in	O
Riskonnect	O
.	O

There	O
will	O
be	O
a	O
5	O
-	O
person	O
panel	O
that	O
will	O
meet	O
monthly	O
to	O
determine	O
preventability	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
include	O
:	O
1	O
Fleet	O
Manager	O
;	O
1	O
Safety	O
Manager	O
:	O

1	O
HR	O
Manager	O
:	O

2	O
Drivers	O
.	O

program	O
will	O
supplement	O
the	O
existing	O

driver	O

for	O
points	O
for	O

MVR	O

being	O

to	O
the	O

from	O
a	O

EVP	O

Regional	O
Manager	O
.	O

?	O

In	O
addition	O
to	O
their	O
VP	O
of	O
EH&S	O
,	O
Beacon	S-ORG
hired	O
a	O
Claims	O
Manager	O
in	O
November	O
.	O

She	O
has	O
an	O
extensive	O
background	O
in	O
return	O
to	O
work	O

.	O

will	O
be	O

on	O

to	O
work	O
and	O
management	O
of	O
problematic	O
claims	O
.	O

?	O

For	O
branch	O
managers	O
,	O
district	O
managers	O
,	O
regional	O
vice	O
presidents	O
and	O
executive	O

presidents	O
will	O
have	O
their	O
bonus	O
tied	O
to	O
safety	O
scorecard	O
performance	O
.	O

branch	O
managers	O
and	O
district	O
managers	O

20	O
%	O
of	O
their	O
bonus	O
will	O
be	O

to	O
the	O
safety	O
scorecard	O
performance	O
.	O

RVPs	O
and	O
EVPs	O
,	O
10	O
%	O
will	O
be	O
tied	O
to	O
safety	O
scorecard	O
performance	O
.	O

If	O
safety	O
scorecard	O
performance	O
is	O
<	O
75	O
%	O
,	O
then	O
management	O
will	O
not	O
be	O

for	O
the	O
safety	O
scorecard	O
portion	O
of	O
their	O
bonus	O
.	O

?	O

was	O

in	O

new	O

system	O

has	O

DISCLOSURE	O
NOTICE	O

This	O
presentation	O
contains	O
information	O
about	O
management	O
's	O
view	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
's	O
future	O

,	O

and	O
prospects	O
that	O
constitute	O
forward	O
-	O
looking	O
statements	O
for	O
purposes	O
of	O
the	O
safe	O
harbor	O
provisions	O
under	O
the	O
Private	O
Securities	O
Litigation	O
Reform	O
Act	O
of	O
1995	O
.	O

Actual	O
results	O
may	O
differ	O
materially	O
from	O
those	O
indicated	O
by	O
such	O
forward	O
-	O
looking	O
statements	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
various	O
important	O
factors	O
,	O
including	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
limited	O
to	O
,	O
those	O
set	O
forth	O
in	O
the	O
"	O
Risk	O
Factors	O
"	O
section	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
's	O
latest	O
Form	O
10	O
-	O
K	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
the	O
forward	O
-	O
looking	O
statements	O
included	O
in	O
this	O
presentation	O
represent	O
the	O
Company	O
's	O
views	O
as	O
of	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
this	O
presentation	O
and	O
these	O
views	O
could	O
change	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
while	O
the	O
Company	O
may	O
elect	O
to	O
update	O
these	O
forward	O
-	O
looking	O
statements	O
at	O
some	O
point	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
specifically	O
disclaims	O
any	O
obligation	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
,	O
other	O
than	O
as	O
required	O
by	O
federal	O
securities	O
laws	O
.	O

These	O
forward	O
-	O
looking	O
statements	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
relied	O
upon	O
as	O
representing	O
the	O
Company	O
's	O
views	O
as	O
of	O
any	O
date	O
subsequent	O
to	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
this	O
presentation	O
.	O

This	O
presentation	O
contains	O
references	O
to	O
certain	O
financial	O
measures	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
presented	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Generally	O
Accepted	O
Accounting	O
Principles	O
(	O
“	O
GAAP	O
"	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Company	O
utilizes	O
non-GAAP	O
financial	O
measures	O
to	O
analyze	O
and	O
report	O
operating	O
results	O
that	O
are	O
unaffected	O
by	O
differences	O
in	O
capital	O
structures	O
,	O
capital	O
investment	O
cycles	O
,	O
and	O
varying	O
ages	O
of	O
related	O
assets	O
.	O

Although	O
the	O
Company	O
believes	O
these	O
measures	O
provide	O
a	O
useful	O
representation	O
of	O
performance	O
,	O
non-GAAP	O
financial	O
measures	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
considered	O
in	O
isolation	O
or	O
as	O
a	O
substitute	O
for	O
any	O
items	O
calculated	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
GAAP	O
.	O

A	O
reconciliation	O
of	O
these	O
non-GAAP	O
financial	O
measures	O
to	O
their	O
most	O
directly	O
comparable	O
GAAP	O
financial	O
measure	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
Appendix	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
Company	O
’s	O
latest	O
Form	O
8	O

.	O

of	O
Terrorism	O

losses	O
arising	O

of	O

CG	O
21	O
33	O
11	O
85	O
Exclusion	O
-	O
Designated	O
Products	O
-	O
"	O
Drywall	O
"	O
manufactured	O
in	O
China	O
between	O
2004	O
and	O
2008	O
,	O
including	O
any	O
discharge	O
,	O
dispersal	O
,	O
release	O
,	O
emission	O
,	O
migration	O
,	O
or	O
escape	O
of	O
vapors	O
,	O
fumes	O
,	O
particulate	O
,	O
dust	O
,	O
fibers	O
,	O
odors	O
,	O
minerals	O
,	O
chemicals	O
,	O
or	O
any	O
other	O
substance	O
or	O
material	O
from	O
“	O
drywall	O
”	O
manufactured	O
in	O
China	O
or	O
produced	O
or	O
released	O
by	O
“	O
drywall	O
”	O
manufactured	O
in	O
China	O
during	O
that	O
time	O
period	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
this	O
endorsement	O
,	O
“	O
Drywall	O
”	O
means	O
any	O
building	O
material	O
that	O
is	O
typically	O
made	O
of	O
a	O
layer	O
of	O
gypsum	O
plaster	O
pressed	O
between	O
two	O
sheets	O
of	O
paper	O
or	O
of	O
a	O
paper	O
liner	O
wrapped	O
around	O
an	O
inner	O
core	O
made	O
primarily	O
from	O
gypsum	O
plaster	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
commonly	O
used	O
as	O
finish	O
construction	O
for	O
interior	O
walls	O
and	O
ceilings	O
.	O

The	O
definition	O
of	O
“	O
drywall	O
”	O
as	O
used	O
herein	O
includes	O
any	O
and	O
all	O
industry	O
and	O
trade	O
related	O
names	O
and	O
references	O
,	O
including	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
limited	O
to	O
,	O
gypsum	O
board	O
,	O
wallboard	O
,	O
plasterboard	O
,	O
Gibraltar	O
board	O
(	O
or	O
gib	O
)	O
,	O
rock	O
lath	O
,	O
Sheetrock	O
®	O
or	O
sheetrock	O
,	O
gyproc	O
,	O
pladur	O
,	O
rigips	O
,	O
alcipan	O
,	O
or	O
board	O
.	O

Remarks	O
:	O

?	O

The	O
U.S.	O
Foreign	O
Account	O
Tax	O
Compliance	O

Act	O
,	O
commonly	O
known	O
as	O
“	O
FATCA	O
”	O
,	O
became	O
the	O
law	O
in	O
the	O
U.S.	O
in	O
March	O
of	O
2010	O
and	O
becomes	O
effective	O
July	O
1	O
,	O
2014	O
.	O

Pursuant	O
to	O
FATCA	O
,	O
brokers	O
,	O
producers	O
,	O
agents	O
and	O
/	O
or	O
clients	O
may	O
need	O
to	O
obtain	O
withholding	O
certificates	O
,	O
from	O
insurance	O
companies	O
.	O

For	O
information	O
on	O
how	O
to	O
obtain	O
the	O
applicable	O
withholding	O
certificate	O
from	O
Chubb	B-ORG
U.S.	E-ORG
insurance	O
companies	O
,	O
please	O
go	O
to	O
http://www2.chubb.com/us-en/u-s-foreign-account-tax-	B-WEBSITE
compliance-act-fatca.aspx	E-WEBSITE

?	O

Please	O
be	O
advised	O
that	O
we	O
do	O
not	O
review	O
Certificates	O
of	O
Insurance	O
issued	O
by	O
you	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
any	O
party	O
,	O
relating	O
to	O
this	O
policy	O
of	O
insurance	O
either	O
for	O
content	O
or	O
accuracy	O
.	O

Accordingly	O
,	O
we	O
request	O
that	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
provide	O
copies	O
of	O
certificates	O
to	O
us	O
for	O
review	O
or	O
for	O
our	O
records	O
.	O

Authority	O
is	O
granted	O
to	O
you	O
for	O
the	O
limited	O
purpose	O
of	O
issuing	O
unmodified	O
ACORD	O
Certificates	O
(	O
ACORD	O
25	O
for	O
Casualty	O
and	O
ACORD	O
24	O
for	O
Property	O
and	O
Inland	O
Marine	O
)	O
only	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
your	O
responsibility	O
to	O
see	O
that	O
any	O
Certificate	O
provides	O
an	O
accurate	O
representation	O
of	O
the	O
coverage	O
form	O
and	O
endorsements	O
applicable	O
to	O
this	O
policy	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
the	O
Certificate	O
is	O
issued	O
.	O

Any	O
modification	O
of	O
the	O
approved	O
ACORD	O
forms	O
specifically	O
set	O
forth	O
above	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
issuance	O
of	O
a	O
non-approved	O
Certificate	O
of	O
Insurance	O
ACORD	O
or	O
other	O
is	O
prohibited	O
.	O

Certificates	O
of	O
Insurance	O
may	O
only	O
be	O
issued	O
as	O
a	O
matter	O
of	O
information	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
no	O
authority	O
by	O
virtue	O
of	O
a	O
Certificate	O
or	O
otherwise	O
,	O
to	O
amend	O
,	O
extend	O
or	O
otherwise	O
alter	O
coverage	O
afforded	O
under	O
this	O
policy	O
.	O

Certificates	O
of	O
Insurance	O
are	O
never	O
recognized	O
as	O
endorsements	O
or	O
policy	O
change	O
requests	O
.	O

You	O
must	O
submit	O
a	O
separate	O
written	O
request	O
if	O
an	O
endorsement	O
or	O
policy	O
change	O
is	O
requested	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
event	O
a	O
policy	O
change	O
is	O
requested	O
,	O
the	O
underwriter	O
will	O
advise	O
if	O
the	O
request	O
is	O
acceptable	O
to	O
the	O
Company	O
.	O

?	O

State	O
Deregulation	O

Form	O
must	O
be	O
completed	O
,	O
signed	O
by	O
the	O
insured	O
and	O
returned	O
to	O
the	O
underwriter	O
upon	O
binding	O
.	O

?	O

Loss	O
Control	O
Survey	O
:	O

In	O
an	O
effort	O
to	O
supplement	O
the	O
information	O
provided	O
in	O
the	O
insurance	O
application	O
,	O
we	O
typically	O
initiate	O
a	O
risk	O
control	O
survey	O
in	O
which	O
a	O
risk	O
control	O
consultant	O
meets	O
or	O
confers	O
with	O
the	O
insured	O
either	O
through	O
a	O
physical	O
site	O
inspection	O
or	O
teleconference	O
.	O

We	O
reserve	O
our	O
right	O
to	O
schedule	O
such	O
survey	O
during	O
the	O
policy	O
period	O
.	O

In	O
every	O
case	O
,	O
the	O
risk	O
control	O
consultant	O
will	O
contact	O
the	O
broker	O
to	O
arrange	O
the	O
inspection	O
and	O
compliance	O
with	O
any	O
mandatory	O
recommendations	O
is	O
expected	O
within	O
45	O
days	O
of	O
receipt	O
of	O
the	O
Recommendation	O
Letter	O
.	O

?	O

Actual	O
coverage	O
will	O
be	O
determined	O
by	O
and	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
policy	O
as	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
insurer	O
.	O

Quote	O
Expiration	O

Date	O
:	O

earlier	O
of	O
the	O

date	O
or	O
30	O
days	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
this	O
quote	O
.	O

Policyholder	O

POLICYHOLDER	O
DISCLOSURE	O
NOTICE	O
OF	O
TERRORISM	O
INSURANCE	O
COVERAGE	O

Coverage	O
for	O
acts	O
of	O
terrorism	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
your	O
policy	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
hereby	O
notified	O
that	O
under	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O

Act	O
,	O
as	O
amended	O
in	O
2015	O
,	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
has	O
changed	O
.	O

As	O
defined	O
in	O
Section	O
102	O
(	O
1	O
)	O
of	O
the	O
Act	O
:	O

The	O
term	O
“	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
”	O
means	O
any	O
act	O
or	O
acts	O
that	O
are	O
certified	O
by	O
the	O
Secretary	O
of	O
the	O
Treasury	O
---	O
in	O
consultation	O
with	O

the	O
Secretary	O
of	O
Homeland	O
Security	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
Attorney	O
General	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
---	O
to	O
be	O
an	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
;	O
to	O
be	O
a	O

violent	O
act	O
or	O
an	O
act	O
that	O
is	O
dangerous	O
to	O
human	O
life	O
,	O
property	O
,	O
or	O
infrastructure	O
;	O
to	O
have	O
resulted	O
in	O
damage	O
within	O
the	O

United	O
States	O
,	O
or	O
outside	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
certain	O
air	O
carriers	O
or	O
vessels	O
or	O
the	O
premises	O
of	O
a	O
United	O

States	O
mission	O
;	O
and	O
to	O
have	O
been	O
committed	O
by	O
an	O
individual	O
or	O
individuals	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
effort	O
to	O
coerce	O
the	O
civilian	O

population	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
or	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
policy	O
or	O
affect	O
the	O
conduct	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
Government	O
by	O

coercion	O
.	O

Under	O
your	O
coverage	O
,	O
any	O
losses	O
resulting	O
from	O
certified	O
acts	O
of	O
terrorism	O
may	O
be	O
partially	O
reimbursed	O
by	O
the	O

United	O
States	O
Government	O
under	O
a	O
formula	O
established	O
by	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
,	O
as	O
amended	O
.	O

However	O
,	O

your	O
policy	O
may	O
contain	O
other	O
exclusions	O
which	O
might	O
affect	O
your	O
coverage	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
an	O
exclusion	O
for	O
nuclear	O
events	O
.	O

Under	O
the	O
formula	O
,	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
Government	O
generally	O
reimburses	O
85	O
%	O
through	O
2015	O
;	O
84	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	E-DATE

2016	S-DATE
;	O
83	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2017	E-DATE
;	O
82	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2018	E-DATE
;	O
81	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2019	E-DATE
and	O

80	O
%	O
beginning	O
on	O
January	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2020	E-DATE
,	O
of	O
covered	O
terrorism	O
losses	O
exceeding	O
the	O
statutorily	O
established	O
deductible	O
paid	O
by	O

the	O
insurance	O
company	O
providing	O
the	O
coverage	O
.	O

The	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
,	O
as	O
amended	O
,	O
contains	O
a	O
$	O
100	O
billion	O

cap	O
that	O
limits	O
U.S.	O
Government	O
reimbursement	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
insurers	O
’	O
liability	O
for	O
losses	O
resulting	O
from	O
certified	O
acts	O
of	O

terrorism	O
when	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
such	O
losses	O
exceeds	O
$	O
100	O
billion	O
in	O
any	O
one	O
calendar	O
year	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
aggregate	O
insured	O
losses	O

for	O
all	O
insurers	O
exceed	O
$	O
100	O
billion	O
,	O
your	O
coverage	O
may	O
be	O
reduced	O
.	O

The	O
portion	O
of	O
your	O
annual	O
premium	O
that	O
is	O
attributable	O
to	O
coverage	O
for	O
acts	O
of	O
terrorism	O
is	O
$	O
37,364	O
,	O
and	O
does	O
not	O
include	O

any	O
charges	O
for	O
the	O
portion	O
of	O
losses	O
covered	O
by	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
government	O
under	O
the	O
Act	O
.	O

Compliance	O
Act	O
(	O
FATCA	O
)	O
The	O
U.S.	O
Foreign	O
Account	O
Tax	O
Compliance	O
Act	O
,	O
commonly	O
known	O
as	O
“	O
FATCA	O
”	O
,	O
became	O
the	O
law	O
in	O
the	O
U.S.	O
in	O
March	O
of	O
2010	O
and	O
becomes	O
effective	O
July	B-DATE
1	I-DATE
,	I-DATE
2014	E-DATE
.	O

Pursuant	O
to	O
FATCA	O
,	O
brokers	O
,	O
producers	O
,	O
agents	O
and	O
/	O
or	O
clients	O
may	O
need	O
to	O
obtain	O
withholding	O
certificates	O
from	O
insurance	O
companies	O
.	O

information	O
on	O
how	O
to	O
obtain	O
the	O
applicable	O
withholding	O
certificate	O
from	O
CHUBB	B-ORG
U.S.	E-ORG
insurance	O
companies	O
,	O
please	O
go	O
to	O
the	O
following	O
web	O
site	O

:	O

excludes	O
:	O

1	O
.	O

.	O

2	O
.	O

country	O
or	O
jurisdiction	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
subject	O
of	O
trade	O
or	O
economic	O
sanctions	O
imposed	O
by	O
the	O
laws	O
or	O
regulations	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
of	O
America	O

In	O
jurisdictions	O
where	O
we	O
may	O
be	O
prevented	O
by	O
law	O
or	O
otherwise	O
from	O
paying	O
on	O
behalf	O
of	O
or	O
defending	O
an	O
insured	O
,	O
rather	O
than	O
directly	O
defend	O
such	O
insured	O
,	O
we	O
will	O
indemnify	O
the	O
first	O
named	O
insured	O
on	O
the	O
Master	O
policy	O
for	O
defense	O

a	O

against	O
such	O
insured	O
in	O

with	O
the	O
Master	O

terms	O
,	O
conditions	O
and	O

.	O

:	O

may	O

any	O

or	O
legally	O
required	O
insurance	O
in	O

.	O

“	O

CAP	O
ON	O
LOSSES	O
FROM	O
CERTIFIED	O
ACTS	O
OF	O
TERRORISM	O
,	O
KIDNAP	O
AND	O
EXTORTION	O
COVERAGE	O

This	O
endorsement	O
modifies	O
insurance	O
provided	O
under	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

Corporate	O
Kidnap	O
and	O
Extortion	O
Coverage	O
Form	O

A.	O
Cap	O
On	O
Certified	O
Terrorism	O
Losses	O

“	O
Certified	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
”	O
means	O
an	O
act	O
that	O
is	O
certified	O
by	O
the	O
Secretary	O
of	O
the	O
Treasury	O
,	O
in	O
concurrence	O
with	O
the	O
Secretary	O
of	O
State	O
and	O
the	O
Attorney	O
General	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
,	O
to	O
be	O
an	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
pursuant	O
to	O
the	O
federal	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
.	O

The	O
criteria	O
contained	O
in	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
for	O
a	O
“	O
certified	O
act	O
of	O
terrorism	O
”	O
include	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

1	O
.	O

The	O
act	O
resulted	O
in	O
insured	O
losses	O
in	O
excess	O
of	O
$	O
5	O
million	O
in	O
the	O
aggregate	O
,	O
attributable	O
to	O
all	O
types	O
of	O
insurance	O
subject	O
to	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
;	O
and	O

2	O
.	O

The	O
act	O
is	O
a	O
violent	O
act	O
or	O
an	O
act	O
that	O
is	O
dangerous	O
to	O
human	O
life	O
,	O
property	O
or	O
infrastructure	O
and	O
is	O
committed	O
by	O
an	O
individual	O
or	O
individuals	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
effort	O
to	O
coerce	O
the	O
civilian	O
population	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
or	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
policy	O
or	O
affect	O
the	O
conduct	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
Government	O
by	O
coercion	O
.	O

If	O
aggregate	O
insured	O
losses	O
attributable	O
to	O
terrorist	O
acts	O
certified	O
under	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
exceed	O
$	O
100	O
billion	O
in	O
a	O
Program	O
Year	O
(	O
January	O
1	O
through	O
December	O
31	O
)	O
and	O
we	O
have	O
met	O
our	O
insurer	O
deductible	O
under	O
the	O
Terrorism	O
Risk	O
Insurance	O
Act	O
,	O
we	O
shall	O
not	O
be	O
liable	O
for	O
the	O
payment	O
of	O
any	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
such	O
losses	O
that	O
exceeds	O
$	O
100	O
billion	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
such	O
case	O
insured	O
losses	O
up	O
to	O
that	O
amount	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
pro	O
rata	O
allocation	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
procedures	O
established	O
by	O
the	O
Secretary	O
of	O
the	O
Treasury	O
.	O

B.	O
Application	O
Of	O
Exclusions	O

terms	O
and	O
limitations	O
of	O

terrorism	O

January	B-DATE

of	O

endorsement	O

EMPLOYERS	O
RESPONSIBILITY	O

Solely	O
in	O

to	O
“	O
North	O

“	O
Third	O

”	O

is	O

that	O
:	O

.	O

first	O
section	O
under	O
VOLUNTARY	O
COMPENSATION	O
COVERAGE	O
is	O
deleted	O
and	O
replaced	O
with	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

VOLUNTARY	O
COMPENSATION	O
COVERAGE	O

“	O
Voluntary	O
compensation	O
”	O
coverage	O
applies	O
when	O
you	O
make	O
a	O
claim	O
for	O
bodily	O
injury	O
by	O
accident	O
,	O
bodily	O
injury	O
by	O
disease	O
or	O
bodily	O
injury	O
by	O
“	O
endemic	O
disease	O
.	O
”	O

The	O
bodily	O
injury	O
must	O
be	O
injury	O
to	O
your	O
“	O
employee	O
”	O
.	O

Bodily	O
injury	O
includes	O
resulting	O
death	O
.	O

1	O
.	O

Bodily	O
injury	O
by	O
accident	O
must	O
occur	O
during	O
the	O

BUSINESS	O

Retail	O
Operations	O

The	O
Company	O
's	O
retail	O
grocery	O
operations	O
are	O
currently	O
carried	O
out	O
in	O
Western	O
Pennsylvania	O
,	O
Northern	O
and	O
Central	O
Ohio	O
,	O
Northern	O
West	O
Virginia	O
and	O
Northern	O
Maryland	O
and	O
use	O
the	O
trade	O
names	O
“	O
Giant	O
Eagle	O
,	O
”	O
“	O
Market	O
District	O
,	O
”	O
“	O
GE	O
Express	O
,	O
”	O
“	O
Market	O
District	O
Express	O
,	O
”	O
“	O
Good	O
Cents	O
,	O
”	O
and	O
“	O
GetGo	O
”	O
in	O
their	O
operations	O
.	O

As	O
of	O
February	O
2014	O
,	O
234	O
Giant	O
Eagle	O
stores	O
served	O
Giant	B-ORG
Eagle	E-ORG
's	O
various	O
market	O
areas	O
.	O

Eight	O
of	O
the	O
retail	O
locations	O
are	O
branded	O
as	O
a	O
Market	O
District	O
offering	O
higher	O
end	O
products	O
and	O
focusing	O
on	O
individual	O
’s	O
passion	O
for	O
food	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
operates	O
63	O
GetGo	S-ORG
locations	O
with	O
Old	O
-	O
Fashioned	O
Sub	O
Shops	O
,	O
47	O
“	O
Grab	O
-	O
n	O
-	O
Go	O
”	O
GetGo	S-ORG
locations	O
,	O
and	O
90	O
“	O
conventional	O
”	O
GetGo	S-ORG
locations	O
.	O

The	O
retail	O
grocery	O
stores	O
vary	O
in	O
format	O
from	O
large	O
combination	O
superstores	O
which	O
also	O
contain	O
delicatessens	O
,	O
in	O
-	O
house	O
scratch	O
bakeries	O
,	O
pharmacies	O
,	O
floral	O
and	O
video	O
departments	O
and	O
in	O
some	O
instances	O
,	O
certain	O
sub-tenants	O
and	O
licensees	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
dry	O
cleaners	O
and	O
banks	O
)	O
that	O
sell	O
products	O
and	O
services	O
to	O
the	O
Company	O
's	O
customers	O
,	O
to	O
small	O
neighborhood	O
-	O
type	O
stores	O
which	O
offer	O
basic	O
groceries	O
,	O
meats	O
,	O
frozen	O
food	O
,	O
and	O
produce	O
.	O

Of	O
the	O
234	O
Giant	B-ORG
Eagle	E-ORG
stores	O
,	O
185	O
are	O
owned	O
and	O
operated	O
by	O
Giant	B-ORG
Eagle	I-ORG
,	I-ORG
Inc	I-ORG
.	E-ORG

The	O
remainder	O
of	O
the	O
stores	O
are	O
owned	O
and	O
operated	O
by	O
independent	O
retailers	O
pursuant	O
to	O
the	O
Company	O
's	O
Independent	O
Retailing	O
Program	O
(	O
“	O
IRP	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

No	O
single	O
independent	O
retailer	O
operates	O
more	O
than	O
four	O
locations	O
.	O

The	O
Company	O
extends	O
the	O
opportunity	O
of	O
owning	O
and	O
operating	O
retail	O
grocery	O
stores	O
bearing	O
the	O
Giant	B-ORG
Eagle	E-ORG
name	O
to	O
individuals	O
via	O
its	O
IRP	O
.	O

As	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
IRP	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
licenses	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
trade	O
name	O
,	O
trademarks	O
and	O
marketing	O
programs	O
essential	O
to	O
the	O
operation	O
of	O
a	O
Giant	B-ORG
Eagle	E-ORG
supermarket	O
.	O

The	O
wholesale	O
divisions	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
supply	O
the	O
independent	O
owner	O
/	O
operators	O
(	O
"	O
Independent	O
Retailers	O
"	O
or	O
"	O
IR	O
"	O
)	O
with	O
product	O
which	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
a	O
minimum	O
supply	O
agreement	O
.	O

In	O
almost	O
all	O
instances	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
subleases	O
the	O
store	O
premises	O
to	O
members	O
of	O
the	O
IRP	O
.	O

The	O
sub	O
-	O
lease	O
states	O
that	O
the	O
premises	O
may	O
only	O
be	O
used	O
for	O
operating	O
a	O
Giant	B-ORG
Eagle	E-ORG
supermarket	O
.	O

Subleases	O
are	O
generally	O
offered	O
to	O
the	O
Independent	O
Retailers	O
for	O
the	O
same	O
term	O
and	O
renewal	O
options	O
available	O
to	O
the	O
Company	O
under	O
the	O
Company	O
's	O
master	O
lease	O
.	O

Lease	O
terms	O
with	O
the	O
Independent	O
Retailers	O
generally	O
include	O
a	O
provision	O
for	O
percentage	O
rental	O
to	O
the	O
Company	O
if	O
the	O
stores	O
exceed	O
certain	O
sales	O
levels	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
often	O
recognizes	O
a	O
gain	O
or	O
upcharge	O
through	O
its	O
sale	O
or	O
lease	O
of	O
store	O
fixtures	O
and	O
through	O
the	O
sublease	O
of	O
the	O
store	O
premises	O
to	O
the	O
Independent	O
Retailer	O
.	O

Finally	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
provides	O
services	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
accounting	O
,	O
payroll	O
,	O
advertising	O
,	O
merchandising	O
,	O
personal	O
,	O
food	O
safety	O
,	O
and	O
computer	O
support	O
)	O
to	O
the	O
Independent	O
Retailers	O
for	O
a	O
fee	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
qualify	O
for	O
the	O
IRP	O
,	O
Independent	O
Retailers	O
must	O
pass	O
a	O
background	O
check	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
generally	O
must	O
provide	O
a	O
capital	O
investment	O
of	O
not	O
less	O
than	O
10	O
%	O
of	O
the	O
total	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
store	O
inventory	O
and	O
fixtures	O
.	O

The	O
IR	O
also	O
agrees	O
to	O
attain	O
and	O
uphold	O
operating	O
standards	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
corporate	O
stores	O
including	O
mandatory	O
food	O
safety	O
standards	O
.	O

The	O
Company	O
generally	O
is	O
involved	O
in	O
financing	O
the	O
inventory	O
,	O
store	O
fixtures	O
,	O
and	O
equipment	O
.	O

In	O
some	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
supported	O
the	O
bank	O
indebtedness	O
of	O
its	O
IR	O
's	O
through	O
inventory	O
and	O
equipment	O
buy	O
back	O
arrangements	O
with	O
the	O
lending	O
institutions	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
to	O
the	O
revenue	O
(	O
described	O
above	O
)	O
generated	O
by	O
the	O
IRP	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
realizes	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
other	O
benefits	O
from	O
the	O
program	O
.	O

Each	O
IR	O
bears	O
the	O
responsibility	O
for	O
its	O
own	O
labor	O
relations	O
,	O
and	O

of	O
the	O
stores	O
operate	O
on	O
a	O

basis	O
.	O

of	O
a	O

of	O
the	O

stores	O
,	O

IR	O
's	O

to	O

.	O

to	O

Aon	B-ORG

)	O
